title: Previous Local Folders disappeared following upgrade
content:
Yesterday I upgraded to Thunderbird Version 128.7.0esr. While all of the emails in my old inbox have reappeared in my new inbox, those that I had moved to local folders are no longer accessible because my previous Local Folders are no longer visible. The only 2 local folders that I now have are Trash and Outbox. I am using MacOS 15.3 Sequoia on a desktop.

I have been to Thunderbird Profiles and can find three entries for each of my previous folders (one with a .msf suffix) and one with .sbd). In ultimate subfolders there are 2 files named after each of my previous local folders (one has the suffix .msf), but they are not folders and do not seem to have any readable content. Please see example in attached screenshot.

Can you tell me please how to reestablish my previous local folder so that I can access the emails they contained.

Thanks

Roger Frost
creator: frostrs

title: How can I disable the keyboard shortcut "J" so that it does not mark mail as Junk?
content:
I mistakenly push the "J" key more often than I would like. Thus I accidentally mark innocent messages as spam, and they disappear to the Spam folder of shame. Yes, if I can catch myself right away, I can press the "Command-Z" ("Control-Z") key combination and retrieve them, and then manually mark them as not-spam. But I would prefer not to have the messages marked as spam in the first place.

Also, I don't often have to mark messages as spam. When I do, I am happy to use a toolbar button or a menu item to do the marking.

So, is there a way I can disable the "J" key so that it does nothing, instead of marking messages as spam?

I am willing to write an add-on if that is what it takes. Just point me to the right API documentation.

I am using Thunderbird 128esr on macOS Sonoma 14.7.3.
creator: JDLH

title: Subscription folder list is blank
content: I have 2 email accounts, both IMAP with comcast.net addresses. One account works fine, I'm able to subscribe to all folders. But when I try to subscribe for the other account, the "Select the folders to subscribe to:" list is blank. I've clicked Refresh but the Folder List but is still blank. What could be causing this? I'm considering deleting the account and adding it back, but I would lose some messages if I did that. It is set up with the imap.cpmcast.net server and the settings are just like the other account that works.

title: Is it possible to set a tag/label that is saved on the IMAP server?
content:
Hi,

Is there a way to set tags/labels that persist on the IMAP server? That way I can create an automation tool that can work with the tags that TB sets, or I can have the automation set the tags and have TB recognize them.

This is similar to what GMail does: if I put a tag in the client, I ca use an external tool to process the emails and that tool can see the label.

I searched and I see that IMAP is suppsoed to support keywords or tags but I don't see how that wokrs with Thunderbird.

Thanks,

L

title: Thunderbird forgets or deletes the email account connection password.
content:
Hi, 

 I am having a random problem with Thunderbird asking me for the login credentials to the email account when these should be stored. Possibly this problem is caused by the antivirus, outages or saturation of the internet connection or the mail provider itself giving a login failure and consequently, requesting the login credentials. 
 The only check I can do is to check in Settings -> Privacy & Security -> Password and I see that only the outgoing mail credentials are there but not the incoming mail credentials when they should be stored.

Would there be any possibility or option to never ask for the credentials and can only be changed from the password window?

Thank you. Regards

title: Pošta Thunderbird
content: Dobrý den, tímto bych Vás chtěl poprosit s pomocí s nastavením Thunderbird. Včera jsem si nainstaloval program do nového počítače a ze starého jsem se pokusil přetáhnout všechny e-maily dle návodu. Ale bohužel se mi tam nestáhli všechny e-maily doručené ( za posledních 6 let ), ale pouze e-maily za posledních 14 dní. Naopak všechny e-maily odeslané se mi nahráli. A zároveň mi vše ve starém počítači zmizelo a je to stejné jako v tom novém. Má to nějaké řešení ? Moc rád bych chtěl mít všechny doručené e-maily k dispozici. Předem moc děkuji za radu a odpověď. S pozdravem Maroušek

Il problema è: devo recuperare una mail che sicuramente è salvata in quella cartella Thunderbird di un anno fa, e ho fatto la procedura per il trasferimento come spiegata nell'articolo del supporto, ho provato anche altre combinazioni, senza sostituire tutti i file, purtroppo nulla. title: Sequence of too many copies of what I write in the inbox
content: Dear sirs, I'm Portuguese, I'm in Portugal and the text is a Google Translate translation. I have been using Thunderbird for many years and I am grateful and satisfied with the program but... .... a few months ago I had to reinstall it on my computer and since then an "anomaly" has been happening that I can't solve or find a solution in the help on your website. It's like this.... When I start typing a message, Thundirbird starts a sort of "backup" intermittently presenting a copy of what I'm typing in the inbox at every moment. and on the other hand it doesn't record anything in the drafts folder. Example: If I take, say, 5 minutes to prepare an email, in my inbox I will have ten or more copies of the email I am preparing. I have already reinstalled and searched all your support and I cannot resolve this annoying situation. Can you help? I will be grateful. Rogerio Freire

Any idea what is happening here ?

title: how to check if an email exist before to send it with thunderbird?
content: it seems that there is no plugin for thunderbird or outlook that allows you to check, even for a fee via api, if the email you are about to write exists. because nowadays sending an email to an existing address wastes time and money: 1) you think you sent an email and instead it has not arrived, creating a disservice to a customer who does not receive your email 2) the email sending system blocks you after 1 or a few sendings if you send N emails to non-existent addresses, because it is the typical problem created by spammers and from 1 to 30 non-existent emails sent in 1 hour and the mail server blocks you. 3) for example I had a similar problem with the school, and the limit of 30 is much lower in reality, because those emails bounce and try to resend for several days, I was blocked in a period in which I only had 10 orders per day and 20% of incorrect emails entered by customers.. another example: I have a customer who manages a hotel and in the past he had done improvised mass mailing and was blocked then today among the various emails, he received an email requesting a quote that was incorrect and with only one email he was blocked
